citeinfo.title: Quaternary Geology - Otter Tail Area, West-Central Minnesota (Part A)

descript.abstract:
A County Geologic Atlas is a systematic study of a county's geologic and ground water resources. Geologic studies include both near-surface deposits and bedrock. Ground water studies include flow systems, aquifer capacity, and ground water chemistry. In some areas sand and gravel deposits, sinkholes, or other features are studied. Interpretation of sensitivity to pollution is also part of an atlas. The information is organized, analyzed, and displayed using geographic information technology.
A Regional Hydrogeologic Assessment (RHA) is similar to a County Geologic Atlas in that both geology and ground water are studied. However, a Regional Hydrogeologic Assessment covers a larger area, typically four to nine counties, in less detail. The RHA emphasizes near-surface geologic, ground water, and pollution sensitivity mapping.
descript.purpose: County Geologic Atlas and Regional Hydrogeologic Assessment information is used in planning and environmental protection efforts at all levels of government. Wellhead protection and well-sealing programs are examples of local programs that need geologic and ground water information. The information is also used by businesses and the general public.

timeperd.current: Duration of Study, approx. 1998-1999; published in 1999. Content reflects the geologic information available at the time of study.

theme.themekey: geoscientificInformation, Geology, Surficial Geology, Lithostratigraphy, Elevation topography, Regional Hydrogeologic Assessment

place.placekey: Minnesota, MN, Otter Tail Area, West-Central Minnesota, Becker County (partial) , Douglas County (partial), Grant County (partial), Hubbard County (partial), Otter Tail County (partial), Todd County (partial), Wadena County (partial)

citeinfo.title:
Paper Report: RHA- 5, Part. A. Harris, K.L., project manager, Regional hydrogeologic assessment: Quaternary geology--Otter Tail area, west-central Minnesota: 1999: 2 pls. PLATES: 1, Harris, K.L., and Knaeble, A. R., Surficial geology, scale 1:200,000; 2, Harris, K.L., Knaeble, A.R., Berg, J.A., Quaternary stratigraphy; scale of lithostratigraphic map on plate, 1:400,000. $8.00. Paper map and report are available from MGS Map Sales Office (2609 Territorial Road, St. Paul, Minnesota, 55114, 612-626-2969.)
RHA-5, Part B, Hydrogeology, is available from the Minnesota Department of Natural Resources Ground Water Mapping Program: http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/waters/groundwater_section/mapping/index.html
For the U of M Libraries Digital Conservancy listing of map products see: http://conservancy.umn.edu/handle/11299/708

procstep.procdesc: Investigations begin with a review of existing information, such as earlier geologic maps, soil maps, and hydrologic reports. Drillers send water well logs to the Minnesota Geological Survey, where they are reviewed, interpreted, and entered into the County Well Index (CWI), an interactive data base of water-well information. Building on the previous data, field studies are conducted to improve the understanding of local geologic and hydrologic conditions. Linework is created based upon the field studies and base data, and digitized. Background GIS data layers such as roads, surface hydrography, township grids, etc., are obtained from various sources, as noted in the Entity/Attribute section. For production information on individual data layers, see the file metadata.pdf on the ftp site.

overview.eaover:
The following is an index of the files used in RHA-5; Regional Hydrological Assessment Quaternary Geology of the Otter Tail Area, West-Central, Minnesota, 1998-1999.
Geographic Base: bsan = annotation cover of TR, city, county, river names copg = polygon cover of county borders hyln = modified line cover of rivers lkpg = modified polygon cover of lakes lkpgct = poly cover of lakes modified for cartographics llpt = point cover of lat-lon tics plsln = line/poly cover of twnshp/rng/section lines papg = polygon cover of project area boundary rdln1 = modified line cover of major roads rdln2 = modified line cover of secondary roads rdpt = point cover of highway symbol
COVERS: qspg = polygon cover of lithostrat units lslni = line cover of ice margins lsln = line cover of geomorphic line symbols qgpt = point cover of quaternary points; giddings,hand smpls, textural analysis, scientific hole sgan = anno/line cover of surficial units labels sgnt = net cover of surficial geology units tpln10m = line cover of elevation topography xsln = line cover of cross section traces
The cross sections were done in the drawing package Abode Illustrator and are not available as ARCINFO coverages.

stdorder.ordering:
Digital data and PDF files representing map plates are available for download from the University of Minnesota Libraries Digital Conservancy. All digital data for RHA-5A is provided in the "Supplementary Files" download. The direct Digital Conservancy Link to this product is http://conservancy.umn.edu/handle/11299/59783
To obtain the digital data on DVD, or to obtain paper copies of the geologic map plates, contact the MGS Map Sales Office at 612-626-2969.
